snippet: Mo Farah, who won the 10,000 meters last week, completed the men’s long-distance double. Caster Semenya of South Africa, who underwent sex verification tests before competing, ran second in the women’s 800 meters.
abstract: British distance runner Mo Farah, who won gold in the 10,000 meters, completes the men’s long-distance double by winning the 5,000 meters; other track results noted.
lead_paragraph: Mo Farah, who won the 10,000 meters last week, completed the men’s long-distance double. Caster Semenya of South Africa, who underwent sex verification tests before competing, ran second in the women’s 800 meters.

headline.seo: Mo Farah Wins 5,000 Meters at London Olympics
headline.main: Farah Wins 5,000 to Give Home Team Another Title
headline.print_headline: Farah Wins 5,000 to Give Home Team Another Title
